revised_title: Quantum Mechanical Predictions in Intermetallics Modelling for High-Temperature Structural Materials
tldr: This article discusses the role of quantum mechanics in predicting the properties of high-temperature intermetallic materials. The authors review the use of angular-dependent interatomic potentials and atomistic simulations to understand the bonding between constituent atoms in intermetallics, focusing on titanium and nickel aluminides. They explain the importance of these materials for high-temperature applications due to their strength, stiffness, and oxidation resistance.
